text: Castanopsis evansii is a tree in the family Fagaceae. It is named for J. H. Evans, a governor of Puerto Princesa in the Philippines. ==Description== Castanopsis evansii grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The greyish bark is smooth, sometimes flaky. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its ovoid nuts measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Castanopsis evansii grows naturally in Borneo and the Philippines. Its habitat is dipterocarp forests up to altitude. ==References== evansii Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Trees of the Philippines Category:Plants described in 1913
title: Castanopsis evansii
